ARABIC: وَلَقَدْ صَدَّقَ عَلَيْهِمْ إِبْلِيسُ ظَنَّهُۥ فَٱتَّبَعُوهُ إِلَّا فَرِيقًا مِّنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Iblis was correct in his assessment of them and they followed him, except for a group of the muminun.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Thus Iblis found his supposition about them to be true; and except for a section of believers they follow him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Iblis found his estimate of them to be true, and they followed him, except a party of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Iblis (satan) made his judgment about them to come true. They all followed them except a believing group among them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And indeed Iblis made his assumptions regarding them seem true, so they all followed him except the group of Muslims.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And indeed Iblis did prove true his thought about them, and they followed him, all except a group of true believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And certainly the Shaitan found true his conjecture concerning them, so they follow him, except a party of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Iblis proved true his opinion of them, and they followed him, except a party of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And Satan indeed found his calculation true concerning them, for they follow him, all save a group of true believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Satan was correct in his assessment of them and they all followed him, except for a band of true believers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And assuredly Iblis found his conjecture true concerning them; and they followed him all save a party of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Certainly Iblis had his conjecture come true about them. So they followed him—all except a part of the faithful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And on them did Satan prove true his idea, and they followed him, all but a party that believed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And indeed Iblis (Satan) did prove true his thought about them, and they followed him, all except a group of true believers (in the Oneness of Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: iblis' made his guess true to them; and all except for a party of believers followed him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Satan was correct in his assessment of them. They followed him, except for a group of believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And Iblees had already confirmed through them his assumption, so they followed him, except for a party of believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [34:20] And verily Iblīs proved true (read sadaqa or saddaqa) his opinion of them, that is, of the disbelievers among them — [the folk of] Sheba — which was that by his tempting them to go astray, they would follow him. So they followed him ([if the verb above is read] sadaqa, this would mean that ‘he was right in his opinion’, and [if read] saddaqa, it would mean that ‘he found this [opinion of his] to be true’) — [all] except a group of the believers (mina’l-mu’minīna, [the min, ‘of’] is explicative [not partitive], in other words, [all except that group] who were the believers: they did not follow him).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And Satan indeed found his calculation true concerning them, for they follow him) in their disbelief, (all save a group of true believers) it is also said that this means: they followed him by engaging in transgressions except for a group of believers who will enter Paradise without reckoning or punishment.
